meanings.definition: A type of eyeglasses with two lenses.
meanings.sent1: She wore her binocle to read the tiny print.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used a binocle to examine the specimen closely.
meanings.sent3: The detective put on his binocle to search for clues.
meanings.sent4: His binocle revealed the hidden details of the painting.
meanings.sent5: Through his binocle, he saw the world in a clearer light.

meanings.definition: A small, single eyeglass lens worn by a person with one eye.
meanings.sent1: The pirate wore a binocle to cover his injured eye.
meanings.sent2: She looked mysterious with a binocle over one eye.
meanings.sent3: The comedian wore a binocle for a silly pirate skit.
meanings.sent4: The binocle gave him a unique perspective on the world.
meanings.sent5: With the binocle, he saw the world through a different lens.

meanings.definition: A type of card game played with a deck of 32 cards.
meanings.sent1: They gathered around the table to play binocle after dinner.
meanings.sent2: Binocle is a fun card game that requires strategy.
meanings.sent3: The family always argues over who will win at binocle.
meanings.sent4: In binocle, luck and skill intertwine to determine the winner.
meanings.sent5: Playing binocle together strengthens family bonds.
